__inputs.name: DS_BIGQUERY
__inputs.label: BigQuery
__inputs.description: BigQuery data source pointing to durham-weather-466502

title: Durham Resident Dashboard (Limited)
description: Resident-facing dashboard scoped to residence-isolated secure view data.

list.name: metric_name
list.label: Metric
list.definition: WITH allowed AS (SELECT 'temperature' AS metric_name UNION ALL SELECT 'humidity' AS metric_name UNION ALL SELECT 'pm2_5_mv_corrected' AS metric_name UNION ALL SELECT 'co2_ppm' AS metric_name UNION ALL SELECT 'voc_mgm3' AS metric_name) SELECT metric_name FROM allowed ORDER BY metric_name
list.query: WITH allowed AS (SELECT 'temperature' AS metric_name UNION ALL SELECT 'humidity' AS metric_name UNION ALL SELECT 'pm2_5_mv_corrected' AS metric_name UNION ALL SELECT 'co2_ppm' AS metric_name UNION ALL SELECT 'voc_mgm3' AS metric_name) SELECT metric_name FROM allowed ORDER BY metric_name

panels.title: Individual Sensors per Network — your residence
Air Assure (AA) Sensors — your residence
panels.description: One line per AA sensor at selected residence.

targets.rawSql: SELECT day_ts AS time, sensor_name AS metric, ROUND(avg_value,3) AS value FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_name LIKE 'AA-%' AND metric_name='$metric_name' AND $__timeFilter(day_ts) ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Bluesky (BS) Sensors — your residence
panels.description: One line per BS sensor at selected residence.

targets.rawSql: SELECT day_ts AS time, sensor_name AS metric, ROUND(avg_value,3) AS value FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_name LIKE 'BS-%' AND metric_name='$metric_name' AND $__timeFilter(day_ts) ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Ambient (AM) Sensors — your residence
panels.description: One line per AM sensor at selected residence.

targets.rawSql: SELECT day_ts AS time, sensor_name AS metric, ROUND(avg_value,3) AS value FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_name LIKE 'AM-%' AND metric_name='$metric_name' AND $__timeFilter(day_ts) ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Colocation Network Comparison — AA vs BS vs Ambient (your residence)
AA vs BS vs AM — Daily Averages (your residence / $metric_name)
panels.description: Sensors at same residence should track closely. Divergence = network disagreement.

targets.rawSql: SELECT day_ts AS time, 'Air Assure (AA)' AS metric, ROUND(AVG(avg_value),3) AS value FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_name LIKE 'AA-%' AND metric_name='$metric_name' AND $__timeFilter(day_ts) GROUP BY day_ts ORDER BY time ASC

SELECT day_ts AS time, 'Bluesky (BS)' AS metric, ROUND(AVG(avg_value),3) AS value FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_name LIKE 'BS-%' AND metric_name='$metric_name' AND $__timeFilter(day_ts) GROUP BY day_ts ORDER BY time ASC

SELECT day_ts AS time, 'Ambient (AM)' AS metric, ROUND(AVG(avg_value),3) AS value FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_name LIKE 'AM-%' AND metric_name='$metric_name' AND $__timeFilter(day_ts) GROUP BY day_ts ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Network Agreement Stats (your residence / $metric_name)
panels.description: Daily AA, BS, AM averages and AA−BS / BS−AM deltas. Red = large disagreement.

targets.rawSql: WITH aa AS (SELECT day_ts, ROUND(AVG(avg_value),3) AS aa_val FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_name LIKE 'AA-%' AND metric_name='$metric_name' AND $__timeFilter(day_ts) GROUP BY day_ts), bs AS (SELECT day_ts, ROUND(AVG(avg_value),3) AS bs_val FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_name LIKE 'BS-%' AND metric_name='$metric_name' AND $__timeFilter(day_ts) GROUP BY day_ts), am AS (SELECT day_ts, ROUND(AVG(avg_value),3) AS am_val FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_name LIKE 'AM-%' AND metric_name='$metric_name' AND $__timeFilter(day_ts) GROUP BY day_ts) SELECT COALESCE(aa.day_ts,bs.day_ts,am.day_ts) AS time, aa.aa_val AS air_assure, bs.bs_val AS bluesky, am.am_val AS ambient, ROUND(aa.aa_val - bs.bs_val, 3) AS aa_bs_delta, ROUND(bs.bs_val - am.am_val, 3) AS bs_am_delta FROM aa FULL OUTER JOIN bs ON aa.day_ts=bs.day_ts FULL OUTER JOIN am ON COALESCE(aa.day_ts,bs.day_ts)=am.day_ts ORDER BY time DESC

panels.title: AA − BS Delta over Time (your residence / $metric_name)
panels.description: Positive = AA reads higher. Near zero = networks agree. Large swings flag drift.

targets.rawSql: WITH aa AS (SELECT day_ts, AVG(avg_value) AS aa_val FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_name LIKE 'AA-%' AND metric_name='$metric_name' AND $__timeFilter(day_ts) GROUP BY day_ts), bs AS (SELECT day_ts, AVG(avg_value) AS bs_val FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_name LIKE 'BS-%' AND metric_name='$metric_name' AND $__timeFilter(day_ts) GROUP BY day_ts) SELECT aa.day_ts AS time, 'AA - BS' AS metric, ROUND(aa.aa_val - bs.bs_val, 3) AS value FROM aa JOIN bs ON aa.day_ts=bs.day_ts ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: BS − AM Delta over Time (your residence / $metric_name)
panels.description: Positive = Bluesky reads higher than Ambient. Consistent offset suggests calibration difference.

targets.rawSql: WITH bs AS (SELECT day_ts, AVG(avg_value) AS bs_val FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_name LIKE 'BS-%' AND metric_name='$metric_name' AND $__timeFilter(day_ts) GROUP BY day_ts), am AS (SELECT day_ts, AVG(avg_value) AS am_val FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_name LIKE 'AM-%' AND metric_name='$metric_name' AND $__timeFilter(day_ts) GROUP BY day_ts) SELECT bs.day_ts AS time, 'BS - AM' AS metric, ROUND(bs.bs_val - am.am_val, 3) AS value FROM bs JOIN am ON bs.day_ts=am.day_ts ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Current State — your residence (Indoor)
panels.description: Latest daily readings for key metrics at selected residence.

targets.rawSql: SELECT metric_name, ROUND(AVG(avg_value),2) AS current_value FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_role='Indoor' AND metric_name IN ('temperature','humidity','pm2_5_mv_corrected','co2_ppm','voc_mgm3','o3_ppb_harmonized','no2_ppb_harmonized') AND day_ts=(SELECT MAX(day_ts) FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_role='Indoor') GROUP BY metric_name ORDER BY metric_name

panels.title: Daily Metrics Over Time — your residence
panels.description: Key indoor metrics for selected residence.

targets.rawSql: SELECT day_ts AS time, metric_name AS metric, ROUND(avg_value,2) AS value FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_role='Indoor' AND metric_name IN ('temperature','humidity','pm2_5_mv_corrected','co2_ppm','voc_mgm3') AND $__timeFilter(day_ts) ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Within-Residence Daily Range ($metric_name)
panels.description: Daily max − min per residence. High = large intra-day variability or sensor spread.

targets.rawSql: SELECT day_ts AS time, 'Home' AS metric, ROUND(MAX(max_value)-MIN(min_value),3) AS value FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` WHERE sensor_role='Indoor' AND metric_name='$metric_name' AND $__timeFilter(day_ts) GROUP BY day_ts ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Pipeline Freshness (Days Behind)
panels.description: Quick lag check for raw and residence-ready datasets.

targets.rawSql: WITH latest AS ( SELECT 'TSI Raw' AS source, MAX(DATE(ts)) AS latest_date FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.tsi_raw_materialized` UNION ALL SELECT 'WU Raw' AS source, MAX(DATE(ts)) AS latest_date FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.wu_raw_materialized` UNION ALL SELECT 'Residence Daily' AS source, MAX(DATE(day_ts)) AS latest_date FROM `durham-weather-466502.sensors_shared.residence_readings_daily_secure` ) SELECT source, CAST(latest_date AS STRING) AS latest_date, DATE_DIFF(CURRENT_DATE(), latest_date, DAY) AS days_behind FROM latest ORDER BY source
